item.title: Andrea add a quote by Nathaniel Hawthorne
item.description: "Children came running with their mothers' scissors, or the carving knife, or the paternal razor, or anything else that lacked an edge (except, indeed, poor Clifford's wits) that the grinder might apply the article to his magic wheel, and give it back as good as new." -- Nathaniel Hawthorne

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Stuart M. Kaminsky
item.description: "We, at least I, need monsters. Without monsters, there are no heroes. Something has to be black and white. ~Lew Fonesca " -- Stuart M. Kaminsky

item.title: Andrea add a quote by e e cummings
item.description:
"wholly to be a fool while Spring is in the world
my blood approves, and kisses are a far better fate than wisdom lady i swear by all flowers." -- e e cummings

item.title: Andrea add a quote by William Wordsworth
item.description:
"I wandered lonely as a cloud That floats on high o'er vales and hills, When all at once I saw a crowd, A host, of golden daffodils; Beside the lake, beneath the trees, Fluttering and dancing in the breeze.
Continuous as the stars that shine And twinkle on the milky way, They stretched in never-ending line Along the margin of a bay: Ten thousand saw I at a glance, Tossing their heads in sprightly dance.
The waves beside them danced; but they Out-did the sparkling waves in glee: A poet could not but be gay, In such a jocund company: I gazed--and gazed--but little thought What wealth the show to me had brought:
For oft, when on my couch I lie In vacant or in pensive mood, They flash upon that inward eye Which is the bliss of solitude; And then my heart with pleasure fills, And dances with the daffodils." -- William Wordsworth

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Paul Chambers
item.description: "Were we to be engaged in a war . . we should become absolutely destitute of elephants. . .What would our children do without elephants to amuse them? What would the sick do without the sight of elephants to invigorate them?" -- Paul Chambers

item.title: Andrea add a quote by S. L. Price
item.description: "Ballet aficionados are just sports fans in formal wear." -- S. L. Price

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Brian Morton
item.description: "The world, the human world, is bound together not by protons and electrons, but by stories." -- Brian Morton

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "...there would be punishment and pain, and there would be happiness, too. That was writing." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Alan Rabinowitz
item.description: "We can never fully understand the hearts and minds of people . . . unless we can speak directly to them in their own language so that the implications, not just the words, come through clearly." -- Alan Rabinowitz

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Caroline Stevermer
item.description: "You must form your own fashions in a way which demonstrates that you flout the standards from knowledge, not from ignorance. . . But I may flout the standards? . . . Of course. What do you think standards are for?" -- Caroline Stevermer

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Louise Erdrich
item.description: "Can you stop your mother from singing to you? Who would do such a thing?" -- Louise Erdrich

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Paula Marantz Cohen
item.description: "She was like a farmer who keeps horses in order to haul away the manure that they generate." -- Paula Marantz Cohen

item.title: Andrea add a quote by L. M. Boston - A Stranger at Green Knowe
item.description: "It's the versatile who survive." -- L. M. Boston - A Stranger at Green Knowe

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Daniel Hillel
item.description: "I get up. I walk. I fall down. Meanwhile, I keep dancing." -- Daniel Hillel

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Sarah Vowell
item.description: "Buffy's high school was built on top of a vortex of evil, the Hellmouth. And whose wasn't?" -- Sarah Vowell

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Peggy Leon
item.description: "I know what I'll do. I'll run away. I'll join the circus. I'll juggle cats. I have experience." -- Peggy Leon

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Brunonia Barry
item.description: "Nevertheless . . was a word, certainly, but much more than a word, it was a concept. "Nevertheless" was what you said when you were not going to budge, whether expressing an opinion or an intention. It was a statement, not a question, and the only word in the English language to which it was pointless to respond. If you wanted to end a conversation or an argument "nevertheless" was your word." -- Brunonia Barry

item.title: Andrea add a quote by John Vaillant
item.description: "The one certainty in tiger tracks is: follow them long enough and you will eventually arrive at a tiger, unless the tiger arrives at you first." -- John Vaillant
